cluster_relations.rel_desc: Waving hello is given as an example of a gesture.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links a specific example or instance to the more general class or category it belongs to.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A thumbs up is presented as an example of a gesture.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links a specific example or instance to the more general class or category it belongs to.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A furrowed brow is presented as a kind of facial expression.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links a specific example or instance to the more general class or category it belongs to.
remarks: Partly supported by entity description; treated as facial expression instance.
Partly supported by entity description; treated as facial expression instance.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Subtle cues in this context primarily refer to facial expressions as sources of emotional information.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an abstract or general concept is primarily realized or instantiated in the concrete form of the target entity.
remarks: Relation created to anchor that the subtle cues mentioned are mainly facial expressions in this passage.
Relation created to anchor that the subtle cues mentioned are mainly facial expressions in this passage.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Eye contact is given as an example of body language in the discussion of its role in nonverbal communication.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavioral category is illustrated or exemplified by the object behavior.
remarks: Relation direction chosen as body language including eye contact as an example behavior.
Relation direction chosen as body language including eye contact as an example behavior.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links a general category or behavior type to a specific instance that exemplifies that category.
args.justification: This relation encodes that eye contact is given as an example of body language, which is the category–instance direction of the same semantics used in the other relations (instance-of gesture/facial expression). Normalizing to a categorization-oriented predicate and class (rather than a separate illustrative_instance_relation in ASSOCIATION) aligns it with the existing is_instance_of usage and clarifies that this is a category–member identity-style relation, not a loose association.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Links a general category or behavior type to a specific instance that exemplifies that category.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation encodes that eye contact is given as an example of body language, which is the category–instance direction of the same semantics used in the other relations (instance-of gesture/facial expression). Normalizing to a categorization-oriented predicate and class (rather than a separate illustrative_instance_relation in ASSOCIATION) aligns it with the existing is_instance_of usage and clarifies that this is a category–member identity-style relation, not a loose association.
